cbinstall.description: Provides a private message system or UddeIM integration for Community Builder.

param.name: general_model
param.label: Model
param.description: Select the model for private messages. Internal will use the plugins built in private messaging functionality. UddeIM will use the 3rd party extension UddeIM for private messaging.

param.name: migrate_uddeim_button
param.message: Are you sure you want to migrate all UddeIM Private Messages? Note already migrated messages will not migrate again and messages are left untouched in UddeIM.

param.name: general_template
param.label: Template
param.description: Select template to be used for all of Private Message System. If template is incomplete then missing files will be used from the default template. Template files can be located at the following location: components/com_comprofiler/plugin/user/plug_pms_mypmspro/templates/.

param.name: general_class
param.label: Class
param.description: Optionally add a class suffix to surrounding DIV encasing all of Private Message System.

param.name: pmsDelete
param.label: Auto Delete
param.description: Enable or disable automatic deletion of private message information for a user when a user is deleted.

param.name: pmsDeleteSent
param.label: Delete Sent
param.description: Enable or disable automatic deletion of messages sent by a user when a user is deleted.

param.name: pmsDeleteRecieved
param.label: Delete Recieved
param.description: Enable or disable automatic deletion of messages sent to a user when a user is deleted.

param.name: general_menu
param.label: Admin Menu
param.description: Enable or disable usage of backend administrator menu.

param.name: messages_icon
param.label: Profile Icon
param.description: Enable or disable display of messages icon on profiles. This will be displayed on the users menu bar above their profile.

param.name: messages_bbcode
param.label: BBCode
param.description: Enable or disable parsing of messages for BBCode.

param.name: messages_replies
param.label: Replies
param.description: Enable or disable display of message replies. Note this does not disable replies and only suppresses their display within a message.

param.name: messages_replies_depth
param.label: Replies Depth
param.description: Input maximum number of replies to display in a message. Set to 0 for no limit.

param.name: messages_system_name
param.label: Name
param.description: Input the substitution supported name to be displayed for system messages.

param.name: messages_system_avatar
param.label: Avatar
param.description: Input the substitution supported image URL for the system avatar. Begin with / for images from Joomla root. Leave empty to display default avatar image.

param.name: messages_system_avatar_style
param.label: Avatar Style
param.description: Select the styling applied to the system avatar. Note for best results use squared images. Circles can display as ovals if the image is not squared.

param.name: messages_system_url
param.label: URL
param.description: Input the substitution supported URL to link the name and avatar to for system messages. Leave empty for no linking.

param.name: messages_public
param.label: Guest Messages To
param.description: Select if guests can send new messages. This will determine to whom guests are allowed to message. Note replying to a guest message will always send an email.

param.name: messages_public_to_access
param.label: Guest Messages To Access
param.description: Select the view access level the recipient user must have for guests to message them.

param.name: messages_message
param.label: User Messages To
param.description: Select if new messages can be sent. This will determine to whom users are allowed to message. Moderators are exempt from this configuration and can always message users.

param.name: messages_message_from_access
param.label: User Messages From Access
param.description: Select the view access level the sender must have to send messages. Moderators are exempt from this configuration and can always send messages.

param.name: messages_message_to_access
param.label: User Messages To Access
param.description: Select the view access level the recipient user must have for users to message them.

param.name: messages_reply
param.label: User Replies To
param.description: Select if messages can be replied to. This will determine to whom users are allowed to reply to in addition to User Messages To permissions. If set to Everyone then users can reply to Guest messages which will always send an email. Moderators are exempt from this configure and can always reply to users. Note system messages can never be replied to.

param.name: messages_system
param.label: System Messages
param.description: Enable or disable sending private messages from the site it self. This will mask the from name and avatar to display as configured below. Note this is only available to moderators and system messages can not be replied to.

param.name: messages_global
param.label: Global Messages
param.description: Enable or disable sending private messages to all users. Note this is only available to moderators and global messages can not be replied to.

param.name: messages_multiple
param.label: Multiple Recipients
param.description: Enable or disable sending private messages to multiple recipients at once using a comma separated list (e.g. tom,hank,john).

param.name: messages_multiple_limit
param.label: Recipients Limit
param.description: Input maximum number of recipients in a single private message. Set to 0 for no limit.

param.name: messages_connections
param.label: Connections
param.description: Enable or disable display of connections selector.

param.name: messages_editor
param.label: Editor
param.description: Select message editor. This will determine if HTML is even allowed or not.

param.name: messages_characters
param.label: Character Limit
param.description: Input maximum number of characters a message can have. If 0 allow unlimited character limit. Moderators are exempt from this configuration.

param.name: messages_captcha
param.label: Captcha
param.description: Select if captcha should be used for new messages. Requires latest CB AntiSpam to be installed and published. Moderators are exempt from this configuration.

param.name: messages_notify
param.label: Notify
param.description: Select if users should recieve notifications for new messages or not. Optionally select if a field should be checked to determine sending notifications on a per user basis.

param.name: messages_notify_field
param.label: Notify Field
param.description: Select a field to check for a value of 0 (No), 1 (Yes, All), 2 (Yes, Not Replies), or 3 (Yes, Only Replies).

param.name: messages_notify_from_name
param.label: From Name
param.description: Optionally input the notification email from name. If left blank will default to registration email from name.

param.name: messages_notify_from_email
param.label: From Email
param.description: Optionally input the notification email from email address. If left blank will default to registration email from email address.

param.name: messages_notify_message
param.label: Include Message
param.description: Enable or disable including the private message in the email notification. Note it will always be included if replying to a guests message.

param.name: messages_notify_offline
param.label: Offline Only
param.description: Enable or disable sending of notifications only if the user is not logged in.

param.name: messages_paging
param.label: Paging
param.description: Enable or disable usage of paging.

param.name: messages_limit
param.label: Page Limit
param.description: Input page limit. Page limit determines how many rows are displayed per page. If paging is disabled this can still be used to limit the number of rows displayed.

param.name: messages_search
param.label: Search
param.description: Enable or disable usage of search on rows.

param.name: messages_orderby
param.label: Order By
param.description: Select the row ordering.
